Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course

Comments_List: 2 hours
6hrs
It was okay, not super interesting but not totally boring.
I was excited for this course because the content is interesting and useful. However, I do not feel I gained additional knowledge by the end of this course.

Strengths: 
-High level / zoomed out perspective of the foundations of health systems and how they function in local contexts 
-Great teaching!
Overall great, would've been nice to discuss more cases.
Couldve been more in-depth

The course has a very interesting topic with a lot of potential. Assignments and workload were fair and well paced. I really wish the class was a little more engaging, and especially that the lectures/slides had more gripping real-life examples rather than having a textbook-feel. It made lectures a little less interesting than I had expected they would be, and I think could be easily approved upon with a more real life rather than abstract focus.
More time could be spent discussing cases - more regular assignments could make learning the content have greater continuity.

Fantastic course. 
Very interactive. 
You will emerge with a solid foundation of main types of health systems, and an understanding of the strengths and weakness of each.
Very good content. Felt redundant at times though.

The class was disorganized and lectures were fragmented and slides didnt differ at all from the textbook. The class would benefit from a restructuring, perhaps with each week being a different countrys healthcare system.
Fantastic course, although at times it felt too high level to be actionable. Got some great insights on what to do as I think about healthcare in the US moving forward.
Very comprehensive overview of components that comprise a health system, as well as examples of health systems across the world.
Great course!
better if reflect more reading material in class. otherwise there is not a strong motivation to do the reading
Informative and kind.

Chima is kind, easy to talk to, and knowledgeable. Although the class was very discussion based, I was frustrated when the instructor was asked an opinion or stance on an issue and it was usually met with an "it depends" or non-definitive answer that did not help further my learning.
Fun lecturer - engages students well. Kind. Passionate and knowledgable about subject matter. Uses different exercises (break-out groups, small activities, etc.) to keep lectures interesting.
Great teaching ability and enthusiasm for the subject.
Great

Chima is clearly an incredible person to know and a delight to speak to. It did not seem that his heart was in teaching the class this semester, perhaps. With more dedication and commitment to the class I think it would be greatly improved.
I really like the instructor and his teaching style.

Fantastic!

Friendly, knowledgeable and encouraging. 

I learned a lot from Professor Ndumele.
A cool professor, shared a good rapport with the students and keeps things interesting in class.
Super nice but didnt plan the lectures much ahead of time
I really enjoyed his teaching style. I think professors who challenge students on their ideas, especially within an industry like healthcare where trade offs are necessary, was refreshing.

strengths:
-good at keeping students engaged through open discussion during lecture

weaknesses:
-Each lecture was WAY too packed, could either remove details of some topics or better organize lectures to make them less dense, as some weeks it felt as though the instructor sacrificed organization for the sake of keeping on top of the schedule

Chima was one of the most dynamic instructors of my time in YSPH! He was engaging and made sure students thought critically about health systems structure and care delivery. He made the class a great balance of lecture and small group discussions. He was also very open to student feedback and suggestions!
excellent
I probably would not recommend it because it was quite boring at times.

It is a course that examines various health systems around the world.
No, I did not get as much out of the course that I wanted to. In addition, I think the group presentation and a lengthy group final paper is excessive and unnecessary.
Great course to take at the end of your time at school to tie everything together!
This course is a great introduction to building awareness about how different countries' health systems operate and interact with each other.
More depth needed.  A good course.
Brilliant - take it!
Yes, I would recommend.
Not unless it was reorganized
Take it if you want a strong understanding of the trade offs necessary in healthcare, and some strategies to learn how to prioritize whats important.
Highly recommend!!
excellent
